info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 6:49PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Rabun, southeastern Macon, southwestern Transylvania, southeastern Jackson and north central Oconee Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 649 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 16 miles north of Walhalla, or 5 miles southeast of Highlands, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Highlands, Cashiers, Gorges State Park, Lake Glenville, Sky Valley, Lake Jocassee, Sapphire, Bad Creek, Whiteside Mountain and Pine Mountain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
